tuv.seg: Horse identification and control
Sainaithint agus rialú capall
If you own or keep a horse or similar animal, it must be microchipped and must have an official identification document, known as a horse passport – see ‘Horse identification’ below

Má tá úinéireacht agat ar nó má choimeádann tú capall nó a mhacasamhail d’ainmhí, ní mór é a mhicrishliseadh agus ní mór go mbíonn cáipéis oifigiúil aitheantais aige, ar a dtugtar pas capaill – féach ‘Sainaithint capaill’ thíos
These requirements are under EU Regulation 504/2008 which, along with later amendments, has been transposed into Irish law
Tá na ceanglais seo le sonrú faoi Rialachán 504/2008 an AE a rinneadh a thrasuí, anuas ar leasuithe a rinneadh ní ba dhéanaí, isteach i ndlí na hÉireann
They apply to all members of the horse family, including ponies, donkeys and crosses, officially known as equine animals but referred to here, for clarity, as horses
Baineann siad le gach ball d’eachainmhithe, capaillíní, asail agus crosálaigh, ar a dtugtar go hoifigiúil ainmhithe eachaí ach dá dtagraítear anseo, ar mhaithe le soiléireacht, mar chapaill
In addition, if you keep the horse in a control area designated under the Control of Horses Act 1996, you must have a horse licence for it – see ‘Control of horses’ below
Chomh maith leis sin, má choimeádann tú capall i limistéar rialaithe atá ainmnithe faoin Acht um Rialú Capall, 1996, ní mór go bhfuil ceadúnas capaill agat dó – féach ‘Rialú capall’ thíos
You are liable for any injury or damage caused by your horse to other people or to property
Tá tú faoi dhliteanas as aon ghortú nó díobháil a dhéanann do chapall do dhaoine eile nó do mhaoin
There are 3 parts to the identification system for horses:
Baineann 3 chuid leis an gcóras sainaitheanta do chapaill:
• An equine (horse) passport, which is valid for the horse’s lifetime
• Pas eachaí (capaill), atá bailí ar feadh shaolré an chapaill
• A microchip implant, which links the animal to the passport
• Ionchlannú micrishlise, a cheanglaíonn an t-ainmhí leis an bpas
• A Unique Equine Life Number (UELN)
• Uimhir Shaoil Uathúil Eachaí (USUE)
The Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine has approved a number of organisations for the purposes of issuing identity documents for horses and maintaining approved databases
D’fhaomh an tAire Talmhaíochta, Bia agus Mara roinnt eagraíochtaí ar mhaithe le cáipéisí aitheantais a eisiúint do chapaill agus bunachair fhaofa a choimeád
The list of these issuing bodies is published on the Department’s website
Foilsítear liosta de na comhlachtaí eisiúna seo ar láithreán gréasáin na Roinne
As well as enabling the identity of an animal to be proved, the passport contains a declaration of whether or not the horse is intended for human consumption
Anuas ar chruthú aitheantas ainmhí a chumasú, cuimsítear sa phas dearbhú maidir le cé acu an mbeartaítear nó nach mbeartaítear an capall le haghaidh tomhaltais ag daoine
This declaration must be signed if the horse is being given certain types of medication that render it unsuitable for the human food chain
Ní mór an dearbhú seo a shíniú má tá saghsanna áirithe de chógas á dtabhairt don chapall, a fhágann go bhfuil sé neamhoiriúnach don bhiashlabhra daonna
The owner can also choose to sign this declaration voluntarily
Féadfaidh an t-úinéir a roghnú chun an dearbhú seo a shíniú go deonach
Any horse that is born in the State must have a passport before 31 December of the year of birth, or within 6 months of the date of birth, whichever is later
Ní mór go bhfuil pas ag aon chapall a shaolaítear é sa Stát roimh an 31 Nollaig i mbliain na breithe, nó laistigh de 6 mhí i ndiaidh dháta na breithe, pé dáta is déanaí
So a horse born in May, for example, must have a passport by 31 December of that year
Ní mór go bhfuil pas ag capall a shaolaítear i mBealtaine, mar shampla, faoin 31 Nollaig an bhliain sin
A horse born in October must have a passport within 6 months – by April of the following year
Ní mór go bhfuil pas ag capall a shaolaítear i nDeireadh Fómhair laistigh de 6 mhí – faoi Aibreán na bliana ina dhiaidh sin
In general, if a foal is leaving the holding where it was born, it must first be microchipped (see below) and issued with a passport
Go ginearálta, má fhágann searrach an gabháltas inar rugadh é, ní mór é a mhicrishliseadh ar dtús (féach thíos) agus pas a eisiúint dó
However, if it is under 6 months old, is not yet weaned and is accompanied by its dam or foster mare, it does not need a passport
Má tá an searrach faoi bhun 6 mhí d’aois, áfach, mura bhfuil sé scoite go fóill agus má tá a mháthair nó a láir altrama ina chuideachta, ní theastaíonn pas uaidh
Any horse being imported into the State from another EU state must be accompanied by a valid passport
Ní mór go ngabhann pas bailí le haon chapall a iompórtáiltear isteach sa Stát ó stát eile san AE
A horse being imported from outside the EU may also already have a passport
B’fhéidir go bhfuil pas cheana féin, chomh maith leis sin, ag capall a iompórtáiltear ó áit lasmuigh den AE
You must register the horse’s foreign passport with the appropriate Irish issuing body within 30 days
Ní mór duit pas eachtrach an chapaill a chlárú leis an gcomhlacht cuí eisiúna Éireannach laistigh de 30 lá
If the horse is being imported from outside the EU and does not have a passport, you must apply to the appropriate Irish issuing body for a passport within 30 days
Má tá an capall á iompórtáil ó áit lasmuigh den AE agus mura bhfuil pas aige, ní mór duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcomhlacht cuí eisiúna Éireannach ar phas laistigh de 30 lá
The passport must accompany the horse whenever it is being moved, whether inside the State or to somewhere else
Ní mór go ngabhann an pas leis an gcapall pé uair a bhogtar é, cé acu taobh istigh den Stát nó go dtí áit éigin eile

In addition, under the Equidae (Change of Ownership) Regulations 2016 (pdf), when a horse changes hands, the new owner must be given the passport and must register the change of ownership with the appropriate issuing body

Sa mhullach air sin, faoi na Rialacháin um Eachainmhithe (Athrú Úinéireachta), 2016 (pdf), nuair a athraíonn capall úinéireacht, ní mór an pas a thabhairt don úinéir nua agus ní mór dó/di an t-athrú úinéireachta a chlárú leis an gcomhlacht cuí eisiúna
When a horse dies, you should return its passport to the issuing body so that its details on the database can be updated
Nuair a fhaigheann capall bás, ba cheart duit a phas a thabhairt ar ais chuig an gcomhlacht eisiúna ionas gur féidir a shonraí ar an mbunachar sonraí a nuashonrú
If the horse has been slaughtered, the slaughter plant will note this on the passport, which will eventually go back to the issuing body
Má rinneadh an capall a mharú, breacfaidh an t-ionad maraithe seo thíos ar an bpas, a sheolfar ar ais chuig an gcomhlacht eisiúna ar deireadh thiar
In general, all horses must be microchipped
Go ginearálta, caithfidh gach capall a bheith micrishliste
However, any horse that already had a passport on 1 July 2009 does not need to have a microchip inserted
Ní gá micrishlis a ionsá in aon chapall a raibh pas aige cheana féin an 1 Iúil 2009, áfach
The passport issuing bodies supply the microchips, which must be implanted by a veterinary practitioner (a vet)
Soláthraíonn na comhlachtaí eisiúna pas na micrishliseanna, nach mór do chleachtóir tréidliachta (tréidlia) a ionchlannú
The information on the microchip is linked to the horse’s passport and to the details registered on the issuing body’s database
Tá an fhaisnéis ar an micrishlis ceangailte le pas an chapaill agus leis na sonraí atá cláraithe ar bhunachar sonraí an chomhlachta eisiúna
The horse’s Unique Equine Life Number (UELN) appears on its passport and identifies it with the issuing body
Sonraítear Uimhir Shaoil Uathúil Eachaí (USUE) an chapaill ar a phas agus sainaithníonn sí é leis an gcomhlacht eisiúna
The Control of Horses Act 1996 allows local authorities authorities to introduce bye-laws designating certain areas as control areas for horses
Ceadaítear san Acht um Rialú Capall, 1996 d’údaráis áitiúla chun fodhlíthe a thabhairt isteach a ainmníonn roinnt limistéar mar limistéir rialaithe do chapaill

(The term "horse" under the Act covers horses, donkeys and mules.) When the local authority is making such bye-laws, it must follow certain procedures, including giving details of the proposed control areas in local newspapers

(Cuimsíonn an téarma “capall” faoin Acht capaill, asail agus miúileanna.) Nuair atá na fodhlíthe siúd á ndéanamh ag an údarás áitiúil, ní mór dó nósanna imeachta áirithe a leanúint, ina measc sonraí a thabhairt ar na limistéir bheartaithe rialaithe i nuachtáin áitiúla
If you are living in a designated control area, you need a licence in order to have a horse
Má tá tú i do chónaí i limistéar ainmnithe rialaithe, teastaíonn ceadúnas uait chun capall a bheith agat
A licence normally lasts for a year
Is gnách go maireann ceadúnas ar feadh bliana
The local authority keeps a publicly available register of all licences issued
Coimeádann an t-údarás áitiúil clár atá ar fáil go poiblí ar gach ceadúnas a eisíodh
When applying for a licence, you must satisfy the local authority that you are a fit person to keep a horse and that the horse will be properly maintained and stabled

Nuair a dhéantar iarratas ar cheadúnas, ní mór duit a shásamh don údarás áitiúil gur duine oiriúnach thú chun capall a choimeád agus go ndéanfar an capall a chothabháil agus a choimeád i stábla, faoi mar is cuí
If a person under 16 owns a horse, the head of the household in which they live is considered to be the owner, as horses may not be sold to anyone under 16 years of age

Más le daoine faoi bhun 16 bliana d’aois capall, meastar gurb ionann ceann an teaghlaigh ina gcónaíonn siad agus an t-úinéir, mar gheall nach féidir capaill a dhíol le duine ar bith faoi 16 bliana d’aois
Anyone permitted to have a horse in a public place must ensure that it is wearing a bridle and is under adequate control
Ní mór do dhuine ar bith a cheadaítear chun capall a bheith acu in áit phoiblí a chinntiú go bhfuil srian á chaitheamh aige agus go bhfuil sé faoi smacht leordhóthanach
It is illegal to allow a horse to graze, feed, stray or remain in a public place without the consent of the local authority
Tá sé in aghaidh an dlí ligean do chapall innilt, beathú, bheith ar strae nó fanacht in áit phoiblí gan toiliú an údaráis áitiúil a bheith faighte agat
If you wish to ride your horse on a public road, you may do so provided that the horse has a licence, is fitted with a bridle and is under the control of someone over 16 years of age

Más mian leat do chapall a mharcaíocht ar bhóthar poiblí, féadfaidh tú amhlaidh a dhéanamh a fhad agus go bhfuil ceadúnas ag an gcapall, go bhfuil srian ar an gcapall agus go bhfuil sé faoi smacht ag duine atá os cionn 16 bliana d’aois
The Gardaí or staff authorised by the local authority may decide to inspect your horse and you must allow them to do this
Féadfaidh na Gardaí nó an fhoireann a údaraíonn an t-údarás áitiúil an cinneadh a dhéanamh chun cigireacht a dhéanamh ar do chapall agus caithfidh tú ligean dóibh é seo a dhéanamh
They can also ask you to produce evidence of a horse licence
Féadfaidh siad iarraidh ort chun fianaise a sholáthar i leith ceadúnas capaill
They have fairly extensive powers of search and arrest if they suspect cruelty to horses
Tá cumhachtaí sách fairsinge cuardaigh agus gabhála acu má bhíonn siad in amhras faoi chruálacht i leith capall
The legislation specifies several offences, including failure to remove a horse from a public place or control area and dangerous use of a horse
Sonraítear sa reachtaíocht roinnt cionta, ina measc teip ar chapall a bhaint ó áit phoiblí nó ó limistéar rialaithe agus úsáid bhaolach a bhaint as capall
You may be arrested without warrant for most of these offences
Féadtar thú a ghabháil gan bharántas i ngeall ar thromlach na gcionta seo
If convicted, you may be fined or imprisoned (or both) and you may be disqualified from keeping a horse for a period
Má chiontaítear thú, féadtar fíneáil a ghearradh ort nó thú a phríosúnú (nó an dá rud) agus féadtar thú a dhícháiliú ó chapall a choimeád ar feadh tréimhse
The court may seize the horse and dispose of it as it sees fit
Féadfaidh an chúirt an capall a urghabháil agus é a dhiúscairt faoi mar a shíleann siad is cuí
As well as unlicensed horses in control areas, stray or unidentifiable horses or horses causing a nuisance or posing a danger may be seized, detained or destroyed

Anuas ar chapaill neamhcheadúnaithe i limistéir rialaithe, féadtar capaill ar strae nó neamh-inaitheanta nó capaill atá ina gcúis le núis nó a chruthaíonn baol, a urghabháil, a choinneáil agus nó a mhilleadh
If your horse has been found wandering 3 times within a 12-month period, it can be seized and you will not get it back
Má thángthas ar do chapall i mbun fánaíochta 3 huaire laistigh de thréimhse 12 mhí, féadtar é a urghabháil agus ní thabharfar ar ais duit é
To have a horse registered, microchipped and issued with a passport, you will need to pay fees to the approved passport issuing body and to the vet who implants the microchip
D’fhonn go ndéanfar capall a chlárú, a mhicrishliseadh agus a eisiúint le pas, beidh ort táillí a íoc leis an gcomhlacht faofa eisiúna pas agus leis an tréidlia a dhéanann an mhicrishlis a ionchlannú
There may also be additional costs for DNA testing etc
Chomh maith leis sin, d’fhéadfadh costais bhreise a bheith i gceist ar thástáil DNA etc
Check your local authority’s website for details of its charges for horse licences and for reclaiming a seized horse
Seiceáil láithreán gréasáin d’údaráis áitiúil chun teacht ar shonraí faoina athruithe ar cheadúnais chapaill agus chun capall urghafa a athéileamh
To arrange to have a horse registered, microchipped and issued with a passport, contact the relevant approved passport issuing body
Chun socruithe a dhéanamh go ndéanfar do chapall a chlárú, a mhicrishliseadh agus a eisiúint le pas, déan teagmháil leis an gcomhlacht faofa eisiúna pas
To apply for a horse licence, contact your local authority
Chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar cheadúnas capaill, déan teagmháil le d’údarás áitiúil
The Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine has published information on horse registration and passports, including a series of FAQs and an information leaflet (pdf)
D’fhoilsigh an Roinn Talmhaíochta, Bia agus Mara faisnéis ar chlárú agus pasanna capaill, anuas ar shraith ceisteanna coitianta, agus ar bhileog faisnéise (pdf) ar agriculture.gov.ie
